sentence.Network_en: This effect was imperfectly understood by designers at that time.
sentence.Network_cn: 当时的设计者们没有完全理解这种效果。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly he began writing in sheer panic , only imperfectly aware of what he was setting down.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然,他慌里慌张写起字来, 只是朦朦胧胧意识到自己写的是什么.

sentence.Network_en: All language changes over a period of time, for reasons which are imperfectly understood.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有语言经过一段时间就要变化, 其变化的原因是无法完全搞清楚的.

entry.tran: 不完美的;有缺点的;有瑕疵的
entry.def: Something that is imperfect has faults and is not exactly as you would like it to be.

example.ex: We live in an imperfect world...
example.tran: 我们生活在一个并不完美的世界上。

example.ex: They have a huge selection of perfect, slightly imperfect and discontinued cookers, fridges and so on.
example.tran: 他们有大量完好的、略有瑕疵的以及已停产的炊具、冰箱和其他货品可供选择。

entry.tran: (动词的)未完成过去式，未完成过去时
entry.def: In grammar, the imperfect or the imperfect tense of a verb is used to describe continuous situations or repeated actions in the past. Examples are 'I was reading' and 'they were eating'.

means.word_mean: 1. in an imperfect or faulty way;

sentences.sentence: "Miss Bennet would not play at all amiss if she practiced more"- Jane Austen

auth_sentence.content: In most cases, though, the underlying conditions are either imperfectly known or not known at all.
auth_sentence.res_content: In most cases, though, the underlying conditions are either imperfectly known or not known at all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In most cases, though, the underlying conditions are either imperfectly known or not known at all.
